meanings.definition: A painful muscle spasm or stiffness, especially in the neck or back.
meanings.sent1: After sleeping in an odd position, I woke up with a crick in my neck.
meanings.sent2: She massaged her back to relieve the crick that had been bothering her all day.
meanings.sent3: Trying to look at the stars for too long gave me a crick in my neck!
meanings.sent4: The crick in his back felt like a knot that refused to untangle.
meanings.sent5: The crick in her neck made it hard to turn her head without wincing.

meanings.definition: A sharp, sudden pain or ache.
meanings.sent1: As she bent down, a crick shot through her lower back.
meanings.sent2: The crick in his knee made it difficult to walk down the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The sudden crick in my side made me gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Each step sent a crick of pain up his leg.
meanings.sent5: The crick in her shoulder made her wince every time she moved.

meanings.definition: To cause a crick in the neck by keeping it in an uncomfortable position for too long.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally cricked my neck while trying to read in bed.
meanings.sent2: She cricked her neck by staring up at the tall building for too long.
meanings.sent3: He always manages to crick his neck when watching movies lying down.
meanings.sent4: The painter cricked his neck while reaching up to finish the ceiling.
meanings.sent5: Don't crick your neck by looking up at the clouds for too long!
